definition: to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract

sentences.english: Now that he was on his legs, it was more difficult to make certain of his age.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他已经站了起来，却叫人更捉摸不透他的年令。

sentences.english: The magazine's stand is very hard to locate.
sentences.chinese: 这杂志的立场观点总是认人捉摸不定。

sentences.english: An encounter with an elusive Canada Lynx is said to be a rare privelege.
sentences.chinese: 据说能遇到难以捉摸的加拿大猞猁是少有的机会。

sentences.english: Coy girls often like to play cat and mouse with Boys.
sentences.chinese: 害羞的女孩时常令男孩子捉摸不定。

sentences.english: The Lightcatcher seems alive because light itself is elusive and ever-changing.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃墙似乎是活的，光线难以捉摸不断变化的。

sentences.english: If over-written, they can become too subtle or cute.
sentences.chinese: 如果书写过度，他们会变得过于难以捉摸。

sentences.english: It turns out passion is not as elusive as we think.
sentences.chinese: 其实，激情并不像我们想象的那样难以捉摸。

sentences.english: I now began to imitate his covert looks .
sentences.chinese: 我开始模仿他那捉摸不定的神色。

sentences.english: The unpredictable quality of pattern shapes is a big challenge in the fashion industry.
sentences.chinese: 式样外形的品质让人捉摸不定是时尚业最大的挑战。

sentences.english: It was his eyes that Catherine focused on. They were a soft gray, unreadable.
sentences.chinese: 柯瑟琳直视着他的双眼，淡淡的灰色，令人难以捉摸。

sentences.english: Or it will be erratic and annoying right through, like a chicken.
sentences.chinese: 要不然就是像一只难以捉摸令人厌烦的小鸡。

sentences.english: I've always found her rather sphinx-like.
sentences.chinese: 我总觉得她像个谜一样，难以捉摸。

sentences.english: It's a subtle but essential question.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个难以捉摸的本质问题。

sentences.english: One of the biggest myths about inspiration that it’s random.
sentences.chinese: 灵感是不可捉摸的，这是一个最大谎言。

sentences.english: Society is the most elusive of the area.
sentences.chinese: 社会领域是最不可捉摸的。

sentences.english: It does not necessarily follow that a deep, intricate character is more or less estimable than such a one as yours.
sentences.chinese: 一个深沉复杂的人，未必比你这样的人更难叫人捉摸。

definition: to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
to be unable to guess or make out
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
irrelevant/can't make head or tail of
